description: A comprehensive, generic Vue.js 3 template designed for rapid development of single-page applications. Built with best practices, modularity, and scalability in mind, serving as a 'super guide' for UI development.

gitStrategy.name: Feature Branching (GitHub Flow)
gitStrategy.details: All development occurs on isolated feature branches, which are then merged into 'main' via Pull Requests after review. Direct commits to 'main' are prohibited.

feedback.name: Alert
feedback.description: A flexible component for displaying various types of alerts and banners, including success, error, warning, informational, and action-oriented messages. Supports dismissible functionality and custom icons.

props.name: type
props.description: Defines the visual style and default icon of the alert.

props.name: title
props.description: The main heading or short summary of the alert.

props.name: message
props.description: The detailed message content of the alert.

props.name: dismissible
props.description: If true, a close ('x') button will be displayed, allowing the user to dismiss the alert.

props.name: actionButtonText
props.description: If provided, an action button will be displayed on the right side of the alert (e.g., 'Reconnect', 'View Details').

props.name: customIcon
props.description: A Lucide icon name to override the default icon associated with the 'type' prop (e.g., 'download', 'bell').

events.name: dismiss
events.description: Emitted when the dismiss button is clicked and the alert starts to fade out. Useful for triggering parent component logic (e.g., removing the alert from a list).

events.name: action-click
events.description: Emitted when the optional action button is clicked. Useful for triggering specific actions like navigating or performing an API call.

slots.name: default
slots.description: The default slot is not explicitly used for content insertion in this component's current structure, as title and message are passed via props. All content is managed internally.

usageExamples.code:
<Alert
  type="success"
  title="Success!"
  message="Your data was saved."
  :dismissible="true"
  @dismiss="handleSuccessDismiss"
/>

<Alert
  type="warning"
  title="Low Stock!"
  message="Some items are running low."
  :dismissible="false"
/>

usageExamples.description: Action alert with a custom action button.
usageExamples.code:
<Alert
  type="action"
  title="Account Update"
  message="Your profile needs attention."
  action-button-text="Update Now"
  @action-click="navigateToProfile"
/>
